formatDescription: Microsoft Access Database File, formerly known as Jet Maseas Database format, is proprietary file format developed and used by Microsoft as a native format for its Microsoft Access (formerly Microsoft Jet Database Engine) desktop database management system. First released in 1992, starting with version 1.0 the earlier versions of the database used the Jet Database Engine, with version Microsoft Access 2000 utiliooing the Jet 4.0 database engine. The page size of the Jet 4.0 database engine is 4096 bytes. The .mde extension refers to protected Access database file with compiled VBA and macros. This entry records the version 2000 of MDB file format, for a full list of versions please follow the links provided in the Notes section.
provenanceCompoundName: Digital Preservation Department / The National Archives

identifiers.identifierType: Library of Congress Format Description Identifier

internalSignatures.name: MS Access 2000
internalSignatures.note: Jet 4 DB header plus variably-positioned AccessVersion 08. Two byte sequences. First byte sequence character sequence, Standard Jet DB. Second byte sequence character sequence, A c c e s s V e r s I o n{0-2048} 0 8 . [0:9] [0:9]
